MODULE_CONTRACT.PURPOSE: Domain module for the account-service managing user profiles, saved configurations, delivery addresses, and user preferences. Integrates with Keycloak for identity (authentication/authorization) while owning profile enrichment data, addresses, and saved product configurations for CPQ workflow.

RESPONSIBILITIES.Item: Store and manage user profiles synced from Keycloak on first login
Manage multiple delivery/installation addresses per user
Store user preferences (language, currency, notification settings)
Manage saved product configurations (drafts) for later retrieval
B2B: manage partner organization profiles and sub-user associations (MVP deferred)
Emit domain events for profile changes and configuration saves

INVARIANTS.Item: UserId must be a valid UUID from Keycloak sub claim
User can have at most one default address per address type (delivery, installation)
Setting a new default address clears previous default for that type
Saved configuration must reference a valid product template ID
ConfigurationSnapshot must be valid JSON matching expected schema
User cannot have duplicate addresses (same street, city, postal code)

UPSTREAM.Item: account-service.adapters.in.web: REST endpoints for profile management
Keycloak (external): User creation and JWT authentication

DOWNSTREAM.Item: account-service.adapters.out.keycloak: Keycloak Admin API (if profile sync needed)

TECHNOLOGY.Item: No Spring/JPA annotations in domain layer
Domain events collected via AbstractAggregateRoot pattern
Shared-kernel value objects: Email, Address, PhoneNumber

PUBLIC_API.Item: UseCase: AddAddress(userId, address, label, setDefault) → SavedAddressDTO

SECURITY.Item: JWT token provides userId from Keycloak sub claim
Users can only access their own profile and configurations
RBAC: ADMIN can access all profiles for support purposes

RELIABILITY.Item: Optimistic locking via version field for profile updates

OBSERVABILITY.Item: Log all profile CRUD operations with userId and action
All logs include traceId, spanId, correlationId from MDC

Anchor.purpose: Sync profile from Keycloak on first login

TESTS.Case: Get profile for existing user returns profile data
Get profile for non-existent user returns NOT_FOUND
Update profile changes name and phone number
Update profile with invalid email returns validation error
First login creates profile from Keycloak user info
Add address succeeds with valid input
Add duplicate address returns ALREADY_EXISTS error
Set address as default clears previous default
Delete address removes from user's address list
Cannot delete the only address if order in progress (future)
Save configuration persists snapshot and returns ID
Save configuration with invalid JSON returns validation error
List saved configurations returns all user's configs
Delete saved configuration removes from list
User cannot access another user's configurations (403)

Decision.Title: Keycloak Profile Sync Strategy
Decision.Rationale: On-login sync is simplest: when user authenticates, extract claims from JWT (sub, email, name) and upsert profile if not exists or email changed. Avoids webhook complexity and reduces Keycloak coupling.

Decision.Title: Saved Configuration Snapshot Format
Decision.Rationale: ConfigurationSnapshot stored as JSONB in PostgreSQL allows flexible schema evolution and efficient querying. Application validates against expected schema before persisting. QuoteSnapshot is nullable for price-free saves.

Decision.Title: B2B PartnerOrganization MVP Scope
Decision.Selected: Minimal implementation - UserProfile with partnerOrganizationId reference only
Decision.Rationale: Full B2B organization management (sub-users, RBAC, partner tiers) deferred to Phase 2. MVP includes optional partnerOrganizationId on UserProfile for basic B2B user identification.

ASSUMPTIONS.Item: Keycloak handles user registration UI; account-service only syncs profile data on first login
Email from Keycloak JWT is always verified (Keycloak enforces email verification)
SavedConfiguration does not validate productTemplateId against catalog-service (validation at retrieval time)
Address validation is format-only; no geocoding or postal code validation in MVP
